programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: Athenian beliefs about Theseus set a standard for judging leaders.

programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: The Achilles-Agamemnon conflict is a lesson in morality and politics.

programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: Hector embodies the virtues most admired by the Greeks.

programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: Homer makes Odysseus\' story into a metaphor for human experience.

programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: Lycurgus saved Greece from civil war and established its institutions.

programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: Solon\'s poetry offers us unique insights into the values of a statesman.

programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: How does King Croesus lead us to reflect on morality and virtue?

programme.title: Famous Greeks
programme.desc: Persia\'s King Xerxes was responsible for the fall of his country.

programme.title: America's Founding Fathers
programme.desc: Could the American experiment succeed? George Washington, one of the most iconic Founders, had doubts.

programme.title: America's Founding Fathers
programme.desc: The failures of Thomas Mifflin offer a window into the problems facing the United States of America in 1783.

programme.title: America's Founding Fathers
programme.desc: How did Robert Morris attempt to restore the links between commerce, agriculture, and government finances?

programme.title: America's Founding Fathers
programme.desc: Here, explore the many roles Benjamin Franklin played in the formative years of the republic.

programme.title: American Military History: From Colonials to Counterinsurgents
programme.desc: Gen. Clark begins the series by plunging you into combat with a 25-year-old Army captain in Vietnam in 1970.

programme.title: American Military History: From Colonials to Counterinsurgents
programme.desc: Analyze Washington's brilliant defense of Boston and his disastrous defeat trying to hold New York City.

programme.title: American Military History: From Colonials to Counterinsurgents
programme.sub-title: Redcoats Fall to the Continental Army
programme.desc: Follow the next four years of the revolution, which ended with the British surrender at Yorktown in 1781.

programme.title: The US Constitution through History
programme.desc: America was born out of a group of ideas and a series of conflicts with England.

programme.title: The US Constitution through History
programme.desc: Reflect on the origins of this system, as well as its inability to deal with economic, military, and diplomatic crises of the day.

programme.title: The US Constitution through History
programme.desc: While America's original Articles of Confederation were an imperfect system, transforming the system with a new Constitution was a heavy lift.

programme.title: The US Constitution through History
programme.desc: After the Philadelphia Convention approved the new Constitution, at least nine states needed to ratify it.

programme.title: The US Constitution through History
programme.sub-title: The Bill of Rights as a Concession
programme.desc: During the ratification process, many states complained that the Constitution did not include a Bill of Rights.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.desc: Begin your tour of treasures from the Smithsonian with the artifact that inspired our national anthem.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.sub-title: Presidents and Generals - Images of Leadership
programme.desc: Learn how some of the country's greatest leaders have seen themselves and been seen by the nation.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.desc: View Smithsonian artifacts that tell the story of the quest for religious freedom in America.

programme.title: Experiencing America: A Smithsonian Tour through American History
programme.sub-title: The Growth and Spread of Slavery
programme.desc: Starting with a set of slave shackles, chart the history of slavery in the Americas.
